intro: Bryodesma arenicola subsp. riddellii, commonly known as the coastal sand lichen, is a member of the family Parmeliaceae. It is a foliose lichen that typically grows on rocky or sandy substrates in coastal areas. The thallus is usually pale green to yellowish in color, with a leathery texture. It lacks distinct lobes but has a dense, compact growth form. This species is adapted to harsh, saline environments and is often found in regions with high exposure to wind and sea spray.
